function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Occupants’ activities and schedules may contribute to the spread of contagious diseases within the houses.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Different occupancy patterns in households increase the risk of disease spread due to movement of people between locations","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High occupancy in the bathrooms during morning routines increases the risk of disease transmission due to shared use of facilities.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Frequent use of electric appliances leads to increased internal heat gain, potentially contributing to the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Occupants habitually leaving lights on in unoccupied rooms may lead to poor ventilation and air quality, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High density of tv sets in living rooms and bedrooms increases the risk of airborne disease transmission within households.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Regular use of vacuum cleaners can lead to the dispersion and circulation of dust, allergens, and pathogens within indoor environments.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Refrigerators are commonly used in kuwaiti residences for storing food, and the presence of multiple units in each residence may lead to cross-contamination if not maintained properly.","category":"Poor access to Diagnostics and Treatment","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Heightened surveillance and mosquito control for urban vbd risks","category":"Poor access to Diagnostics and Treatment","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Spread of contagious diseases such as zika virus, ebola virus, and coronavirus","category":"Poor access to Diagnostics and Treatment","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Data collection from multiple sources in urban areas increases the risk of contagion spread through contact with surfaces or individuals carrying the virus.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of wearable urban health sensors without specific virus outbreak tracking capabilities may result in delayed detection of early symptoms and contribute to the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Poor access to Diagnostics and Treatment","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases through connected health care devices","category":"Poor access to Diagnostics and Treatment","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transmitted majorly through human-to-human contact","category":"Poor access to Diagnostics and Treatment","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases through the interconnected smart systems and humans","category":"Poor access to Diagnostics and Treatment","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases due to increased movement and interaction of people and wildlife as a result of optimized location awareness and autonomous transportation.","category":"Misinterpretation of data and results","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased reliance on telemedicine
